document_data.name: ''Whip-Ring of Loviatar''
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Whip-Ring of Loviatar''''' was an enchanted [[ring]], named after [[Loviatar]] the Scourge Mistress. It was part of the ''Fading Rings'' set.
document_data.Description: The ''Whip-Ring'' was fashioned to resemble a [[griffon]]'s or Loviatar's [[scourge]].
document_data.Powers: This enchanted ring enchanted the wearer's dexterity and made them more alert and quicker to respond to danger. Additionally, the ''Whip-Ring of Loviatar'' allowed the wearer to magically "whip" their opponents, similarly to the ''[[inflict critical wounds]]'' spell. The ring possessed nine charges.
document_data.History: In [[1369 DR]], ''Whip-Ring of Loviatar'' came to be possessed by a mysterious monument, ''the Great Stone Head'', located in the [[Nightingale Court]] in the ruins of [[Myth Drannor]]. In exchange for one of the ''[[eidolon]]s'', small totem statues depicting various gods, the monument dispensed powerful magic rings, one being the dangerous ''Whip-Ring of Loviatar''.
